turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need some legal advice. I'm being sued by my neighbor for property damage. I don't think I did anything wrong, though.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand. I am designed to provide general legal information and guidance. To assist you better, could you please provide more details about the situation? For example, what type of damage are you accused of causing, and what evidence does your neighbor have?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, well, he's claiming I damaged his fence during a windstorm. But honestly, the fence was already old and falling apart! He's got some photos, but they don't really *prove* anything. This is so frustrating!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I see. Wind damage cases can be complex. While I can't offer legal advice, I can provide some general information. Based on the limited information, his claim could be weakened if you can demonstrate the pre-existing condition of the fence. Do you have any documentation or witnesses who can support your version of events? Also, how is the concept of 'proximate cause' relevant here when considering the elements of negligence?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Wow, that's... a bit much. Proximate cause? Okay, I think I get the gist. I'm not sure about witnesses, but I do have some old photos of the fence from before the storm that clearly show its condition. Thanks, that helps a lot! I think I need to talk to a real lawyer, though.
